m:MaterialTitle.title: Basic
m:MaterialTitle.description: Basic values that define your GWT Module.

ghu:StringPanel.title: Module Name
ghu:StringPanel.description: If left blank, by default the module name is the file name, not counting the .gwt.xml part.

ghu:StringPanel.title: Entry Point
ghu:StringPanel.description: This is where the application starts executing code, like a 'main' method. It must be the name of a class, including package, that implements 'EntryPoint'. For example 'com.example.client.MyEntryPoint'.

m:MaterialTitle.title: Resources (CSS/GSS)
m:MaterialTitle.description: Configure how GWT manages resources like CSS, GSS, and UiBinder.

ghu:Panel.title: CSS Style Name Obfuscation
ghu:Panel.description: Define the format used to generate CSS class names used in CssResource and UiBinder. Stable means that the CSS class name will not change between compiles. Unique means there will never be name collisions.

m:MaterialListBox.item: Stable long (stable, show class, show package)

ghu:Panel.title: User Agent
ghu:Panel.description: Determines which browser permutations will be compiled. When none are checked then the default option to create all permutations is used.

ghu:BooleanPanel.title: Collapse All Properties
ghu:BooleanPanel.description: Enabling this option will combine all permutations in to a single output file. This can greatly reduce compile time and is useful during development.
ghu:BooleanPanel.name: Collapse
